Module project.inventorymanagement
Package project.inventorymanagement.Controller

Class AddProductController

java.lang.Object
project.inventorymanagement.Controller.AddProductController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class AddProductController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class creates a controller for the Add Product form.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This is the method that executes when the Add Product form is initialized. It populates the Parts table with all parts and the Associated Parts table with the initially empty associated parts list.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

    • onAddProductCancelClick

      public void onAddProductCancelClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This is the action event method for the Cancel button. It clears the search results and associated parts lists, then redirects to the Inventory Management System form.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onAddProductSaveClick

      public void onAddProductSaveClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This is the action event method for the Save button. The method first checks for any data input errors (including min <= inv <= max and min < max), displaying an error message if any is found. If there are no errors, a new product is created. If no ID is available for recycling, the method assigns the product a unique ID using productsIdCount and updates the products ID counter. If an ID is available for recycling, the method assigns the product the lowest available recycled ID, removes the ID from the recycled ID list and sorts the list of all products for display. If the list of parts to be associated is not empty, the method adds the parts to the product's Associated Parts list. The method adds the product to Inventory then redirects to the Inventory Management System form.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onAddProductSearchTyped

      public void onAddProductSearchTyped(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent keyEvent)
      This is the action event method that handles a character being typed into or deleted from the parts search bar. The method first clears any previous search results from the search results list. If the search bar is not empty, then a search is carried out. The method adds to the search results list every part with a name containing a partial or full match with the search bar's text. The method then adds to the search results list every part with an ID containing a partial or full match with the search bar's text. not including duplicates already in the search results list. The method then populates the Parts table with the search results, displaying an error if no matching part is found. If the search bar is empty, the search results list is cleared and the table is repopulated with all parts.

    • onAddProductAddClick

      public void onAddProductAddClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This is the action event method for the Add button. The method first checks if a part is selected, displaying an error if no part is selected. If the selected part is not already in the associated parts list, then the method adds it to the list and sorts the list for display. If the selected part is already in the associated parts list, then an error message is displayed.

    • onAddProductRemoveClick

      public void onAddProductRemoveClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This is the action event method for the Remove associated part button. The method first checks if a part is selected, displaying an error if no part is selected. The method then confirms the user's action, removing the target part from the associated parts list upon confirmation.
